8. .. g5 9. Ne1 Qc7 10. Nd3
Ng6
then 11. Be3 0-0-0 12. Ne1
Ne7 13. a4 Kb8 14. a5 a6 15.
Nd3 Ng6 somewhat agressive,
counters bishop harrassment
and possible pawn push on the
king's side by white; 9. Ne1
with the idea of king's side
pawn push; Nd3 enables Ng6 as
black's white bishop can be
traded if g5 is played

<
variations of the mainline up
to move 4.
>

<
against 4. h4
if 4. h4 played instead don't
play 4. .. e6 4. .. h6 or h5
instead

Gawain Jones vs Jeffery Xion
4. .. h5 (stops g4) 5. Bd3
Bxd3 6. Qxd3 (6. .. e6 is a
mistake here because of Bg5)
Qa5+ (with intentions of Qa4
-- after Bd2 -- for an
exchange of queens: 7. Bd2 Qa4
8. e6 Qxd3 9. exf7+ Kxf7 10.
fxd3 Nd2) 7. Nd2 (to support a
c4 to block Qa4) e6 8. Nf3
black g knight can aim f5,
white dark square bishop is
blocked can't go to g5

>
g.text: c4 to block Qa4) e6 8. Nf3
black g knight can aim f5,

<
against early 4.Nc3
if 4. Nc3 played instead,
that is about harrassing the
Bf6, after 4. .. e6,
harrassment starts and goal is
to bring knight to f4 (h4 pawn
push) and weaken black king
side by exchanging the black
bishop for the knight4. Nc3 e6 5. g4 Bg6 6.
Nge2 c5 balance the flank
attack with a central attack

>
